name: Hidden Information, World Secrets, and Mystery Physics
description: From private inventories to the fog of war, secrets are central to a game designer's toolkit. Blockchains, however, are inherently public structures. This interactive session will walk you through the art of the possible with weaving secrets and mysteries into onchain worlds. While suitable for nontechnical folk, we may take a few minutes here and there to take a signposted deep dive into some code.

speakers.name: Baz
speakers.bio: Exasperated at the state of the world and the web, we founded Tonk to help liberate the open internet beyond just finance. To that end, we work with onchain game studios to bake hidden information into their worlds. We also authored the Privacy Playgrounds Wiki and started Dappicom, a zkNES emulator in Noir. Our work sits in the sweet spot between applied cryptography, gaming and the philosophy of privacy-enabled coordination.
